title: Virgins of Venice: Broken Vows and Cloistered Lives in the Renaissance Convent
description: Documents the experiences of late-Renaissance Venetian nuns, many of whom were upper-class women immured against their will, exploring how convents of the period were often political hotbeds and the sites of illicit love affairs in their resident's efforts to find fulfillment. 17,500 first printing.
author: Mary Laven
